main event: On February 23, 1958, in Cleveland, Ohio, a ground-visual observation was made of a brilliant orange flaming object, which later segmented into 5 sections and appeared to be moving at an extremely low speed.
interesting points: The object was initially observed as a single light before segmenting into 5 sections.
The duration of the observation was 10 seconds, and the object was seen traveling from east to west parallel to the Earth's surface.
The conclusion drawn from the observation was that it was a balloon, visually analyzed.
There were no photographs taken of the sighting.
A guard at Olmstead, Ohio, and Captain Harrison of the USAF in Cleveland, Ohio, were among the witnesses.
sighted object: brilliant orange flaming object segmenting into 5 sections
witnesses: guard, Captain Harrison of the USAF
